name: Navigation Sidebar
description: The navigation sidebar provides quick access to the list of all channels, direct messages, and threads. It also includes navigation to settings and user preferences.
location: On the left side of the ChatPage

sub.name: Channel Navigation
sub.description: A section that displays and allows navigation through the list of all channels the user is subscribed to within the current workspace.
sub.location: Upper part of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Channel Navigation Header
sub.description: A header section that contains the title 'Channels' and any controls related to the management of channel visibility or settings.
sub.location: At the top of the Channel Navigation section

sub.name: Channel Navigation List
sub.description: A scrollable list displaying each channel the user is subscribed to, allowing for click-through selection of channels to display in the Main Conversation Area.
sub.location: Below the Channel Navigation Header

sub.name: Channel List Item
sub.description: Each entry in the list represents a clickable channel, showing the channel name and possibly unread message indicators.
sub.location: Within the Channel Navigation List

sub.name: New Channel Button
sub.description: A button positioned within the Channel Navigation List to allow users to quickly create a new channel.
sub.location: At the top or bottom of the Channel Navigation List

sub.name: Direct Message List Item
sub.description: Each entry represents a direct message conversation, displaying the contact’s name or group members and possibly unread message indicators.
sub.location: Within the Direct Messages Navigation List

sub.name: New Direct Message Button
sub.description: Button used to initiate a new direct message conversation from the Direct Messages Navigation List.
sub.location: At the top or bottom of the Direct Messages Navigation List

sub.name: Direct Messages Navigation Header
sub.description: A header section with the title 'Direct Messages' and any applicable options for starting new conversations or organizing the DM list.
sub.location: At the top of the Direct Messages Navigation section

sub.name: Direct Messages Navigation List
sub.description: A list showing current direct message conversations, allowing users to click through and open these in the Main Conversation Area.
sub.location: Below the Direct Messages Navigation Header

sub.name: Channel Icon
sub.description: An icon representing each channel type, such as public or private, displayed alongside the channel name.
sub.location: Within each Channel List Item

sub.name: Channel Unread Badge
sub.description: A badge indicating the number of unread messages in a channel.
sub.location: Attached or displayed alongside each Channel List Item

sub.name: Direct Message Avatar
sub.description: An avatar or icon representing the user or users in the direct message conversation.
sub.location: Within each Direct Message List Item

sub.name: Direct Message Unread Badge
sub.description: A badge or counter showing unread messages for direct message conversations.
sub.location: Attached to each Direct Message List Item

sub.name: Workspace Switcher
sub.description: A dropdown or list element enabling users to switch between different workspaces they have access to.
sub.location: Within the Workspace Menu at the top of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: User Profile Button
sub.description: A button or clickable area displaying the user's profile picture and/or name, offering access to personal settings and status updates.
sub.location: Near the bottom or lower section of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Direct Messages Navigation
sub.description: A section that shows recent direct message conversations, allowing users to navigate directly to these conversations.
sub.location: Below the Channel Navigation in the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Workspace Name Display
sub.description: Displays the current workspace name, used as part of the Workspace Menu for context and navigation.
sub.location: Within the Workspace Menu at the top of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Workspace Switch Dropdown
sub.description: A dropdown menu allowing users to switch between multiple workspaces they are part of.
sub.location: Within the Workspace Menu

sub.name: User Status Indicator
sub.description: Represents the current status of the user (e.g., online, away) and allows for quick status changes.
sub.location: Connected to the User Profile Button at the bottom of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Settings Menu Trigger
sub.description: A clickable area or button that opens the full settings or preferences menu for user account customization.
sub.location: Adjacent to the User Profile Button

sub.name: Threads Navigation
sub.description: Provides quick access to threads involving the user, offering a list and navigation feature to jump to these discussions.
sub.location: Below the Direct Messages Navigation in the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Workspace Menu
sub.description: Includes navigation options for switching between various workspaces and accessing workspace-related settings.
sub.location: At the very top of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Thread List
sub.description: Displays a list of ongoing threads that the user is part of or interested in, allowing for quick navigation to specific thread discussions.
sub.location: Below the Threads Navigation Header in the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Profile Picture
sub.description: Displays the user's profile picture in the sidebar, usually as part of the User Profile Button, used for account and status access.
sub.location: Within the User Profile Button at the bottom of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Sign Out Button
sub.description: Provides the functionality to sign out of the current session, often located within the settings menu or user preferences.
sub.location: Within the Settings Menu accessed by the Settings Menu Trigger

sub.name: Settings & Preferences Access
sub.description: A section that includes links or buttons to access user account settings, preferences, and other personal settings.
sub.location: At the bottom of the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Add Channel/DM Trigger
sub.description: A button or link used to create new channels or direct messages, facilitating the creation of new conversations.
sub.location: Typically near the top of the Channel Navigation or Direct Messages Navigation

name: Channel List
description: Displays all the channels the user is a part of within their workspace. This list allows users to switch channels to view respective conversations.

sub.name: Public Channel Item
sub.description: An individual channel item representing a public channel within the Channel List, allowing users to access conversations visible to the entire workspace.
sub.location: Within the Channel Navigation List

sub.name: Private Channel Item
sub.description: An individual channel item representing a private channel within the Channel List, accessible only to specific members.
sub.location: Within the Channel Navigation List

sub.name: Channel Sort Options
sub.description: Options for sorting or organizing channels in the list, such as alphabetically or by activity.
sub.location: At the top of the Channel Navigation List

name: Direct Messages List
description: Shows a log of all direct message conversations the user is engaged in, ordered typically by recent activity.
location: Below the Channel List in the Navigation Sidebar

sub.name: Direct Message List Header
sub.description: The header section of the Direct Messages List, which may include options for managing direct messages.
sub.location: At the top of the Direct Messages List

sub.name: Recent Conversation Item
sub.description: An individual item representing a recent direct message conversation between users.
sub.location: Within the Direct Messages List

sub.name: Active Conversation Indicator
sub.description: Visual indicator highlighting the currently active or selected direct message conversation.
sub.location: Within the Recent Conversation Item, emphasizing the current selection

name: Message Input Area
description: A text input field where users can compose and send messages, attach files, or add emojis to a conversation.
location: At the bottom of the main conversation area

sub.name: TextInputField
sub.description: The main input area where users can compose messages before sending.
sub.location: Central part of the Message Input Area

sub.name: InputFieldPlaceholder
sub.description: Displays a placeholder text within the TextInputField when it's empty, guiding the user on what to type.
sub.location: Inside the TextInputField when there is no user input

sub.name: AttachmentPreviewArea
sub.description: A section that displays previews of attached files or images before the message is sent.
sub.location: Above or within the TextInputField area

sub.name: EmojiSearchBar
sub.description: A search bar within the EmojiPicker to find specific emojis quickly.
sub.location: At the top of the EmojiPicker

sub.name: EmojiCategoryTabs
sub.description: Tabs that categorize emojis into groups such as 'Recent', 'Smileys', 'Animals', etc.
sub.location: Within the EmojiPicker, usually at the top or bottom

sub.name: SendButton
sub.description: Button used to send the composed message in the TextInputField to the chat.
sub.location: Immediately adjacent to the TextInputField

sub.name: AttachFileButton
sub.description: Button that allows users to attach files to their message. Clicking it opens a file selector.
sub.location: Adjacent to the TextInputField, usually on the left or right

sub.name: EmojiPicker
sub.description: A tool that allows users to select and insert emojis into their message.
sub.location: Within the Message Input Area, accessible via a button or icon near the TextInputField

name: Main Conversation Area
description: The primary area for real-time interaction, displaying the ongoing conversation in the selected channel or direct message.

sub.name: MessageBubble
sub.description: Individual container for each message within the conversation, displaying text, images, or attached files, alongside metadata such as sender and timestamp.
sub.location: Scattered throughout the Main Conversation Area in chronological order

sub.name: MessageContent
sub.description: Displays the main content of the message, be it text, image, or file attachments.
sub.location: Within each MessageBubble

sub.name: SenderAvatar
sub.description: An avatar or profile picture representing the sender of each message, allowing users to easily identify who sent the message.
sub.location: Aligned to the left of each MessageBubble

sub.name: ReactionBar
sub.description: Component allowing users to view and add emoji reactions to each message, providing quick feedback mechanisms.
sub.location: Below or adjacent to each MessageBubble

sub.name: ConversationHeader
sub.description: Displays the name of the channel or the contact(s) in a direct message thread, along with options for channel info or starting a call.
sub.location: Top section of the Main Conversation Area

sub.name: ScrollToLatestButton
sub.description: A button that, when pressed, quickly scrolls to the most recent messages in the conversation.
sub.location: Overlayed at the lower edge or corner of the Main Conversation Area when there are unread messages off-screen

sub.name: ThreadReplyButton
sub.description: Button located on each message bubble that allows users to initiate or view a thread discussion related to a specific message.
sub.location: Within or beside each MessageBubble

sub.name: TimestampLabel
sub.description: Displays the time a message was sent or delivered, important for contextualizing message order and discussion.
sub.location: Alongside or below each MessageBubble

name: User Presence & Status Indicator
description: Displays the current online status of users in the conversation, such as online, away, or offline.
location: Next to user names in the direct message and member list

sub.name: StatusIcon
sub.description: A visual representation of the user’s status, such as a green dot for 'online', yellow for 'away', and red for 'busy'.
sub.location: Next to the user's name or avatar

sub.name: StatusDropdown
sub.description: A dropdown menu that allows users to manually set their status as online, away, or offline.
sub.location: Accessible from the user’s profile or settings panel

sub.name: CustomStatusMessage
sub.description: An optional text message set by the user to inform others of their current status or availability.
sub.location: Displayed alongside the StatusIcon in the user’s profile view

name: Threads Panel
description: The panel shows the threads related to the selected channel or direct message, allowing users to engage in or view ongoing thread discussions.
location: Right side of the Main Conversation Area when a thread is opened

sub.name: ThreadList
sub.description: A list view of all threads related to the selected channel or direct message, sortable by recent activity or other criteria.
sub.location: Within the main viewport of the Threads Panel

sub.name: IndividualThread
sub.description: Represents a single thread within the ThreadList, allowing users to see the initial message and a summary of replies.
sub.location: Within the ThreadList in the Threads Panel

sub.name: IndividualThreadCard
sub.description: A condensed representation of a thread with the initial message and latest reply displayed, allowing quick overview and navigation.
sub.location: Inside the ThreadList within the Threads Panel

sub.name: NewReplyButton
sub.description: A button to quickly open the ReplyTextInput for a thread, encouraging user interaction and response.
sub.location: Within each IndividualThreadCard or ThreadMessageBubble in the Threads Panel

sub.name: ThreadTimestamp
sub.description: Displays the most recent activity time or the time since the thread started, providing a time context for the conversation.
sub.location: Within each IndividualThreadCard, usually aligned to the side or bottom

sub.name: ThreadExpansionToggle
sub.description: Allows users to expand or collapse a thread to view more or fewer details directly within the Threads Panel.
sub.location: Within each IndividualThreadCard or at the header of a thread view

sub.name: ThreadActivityIndicator
sub.description: Indicator showing recent activity within a thread, such as the number of new replies since last viewed.
sub.location: Adjacent to each IndividualThread entry in the ThreadList

sub.name: ThreadReplyForm
sub.description: Provides a user interface for writing and submitting replies to a thread, similar to the main Message Input Area.
sub.location: Below the ThreadMessageBubble in an opened IndividualThread

sub.name: ThreadParticipantList
sub.description: Lists the participants involved in a thread conversation, providing context about who is in the discussion.
sub.location: Top or within the IndividualThread view

sub.name: ThreadHeader
sub.description: Displays the title or main message of the selected thread, along with options to perform actions such as closing or following the thread.
sub.location: At the top of the Threads Panel

sub.name: ReplyTextInput
sub.description: Text input field where users can type their replies to the thread discussion.
sub.location: At the bottom of the Threads Panel

sub.name: ThreadMessageBubble
sub.description: Individual messages or replies within the specific thread, similar to MessageBubble but specific to the thread context.
sub.location: Within the ThreadList in the Threads Panel

sub.name: ThreadInteractionArea
sub.description: The section where users can interact with specific thread options such as following the thread or marking it as read.
sub.location: Within each IndividualThreadCard in the Threads Panel

sub.name: ThreadSummaryView
sub.description: Provides a quick snapshot of the thread, showing the most recent replies or user activity.
sub.location: Inside the IndividualThreadCard in the ThreadList

sub.name: ThreadActionButton
sub.description: Button for actions such as opening the thread in full view or jumping to the original message in the Main Conversation Area.
sub.location: Aligned with or at the bottom of the IndividualThreadCard

sub.name: ThreadMuteToggle
sub.description: An option to mute or unmute notifications for updates or replies within the thread.
sub.location: Within the IndividualThreadCard interface, often in the interaction area

sub.name: CollapseButton
sub.description: Button that allows users to collapse the Threads Panel to focus back on the main conversation area without losing the current thread context.
sub.location: Top-right corner of the Threads Panel

name: File Sharing Module
description: A section dedicated to displaying shared files or facilitating the sharing of files within the conversation.
location: Accessible via the Message Input Area or within conversations

sub.name: FilePreview
sub.description: A thumbnail or representation of the shared file, providing a quick glance of the file type and content.
sub.location: Within each file entry in the File Sharing Module

sub.name: FileUploadButton
sub.description: A button used to initiate the process of uploading and sharing a new file within the conversation.
sub.location: At the top or bottom of the File Sharing Module

sub.name: FileSearchBar
sub.description: A search bar allowing users to locate shared files quickly by typing keywords related to file names or contents.
sub.location: At the top of the File Sharing Module

sub.name: FileMetadata
sub.description: Displays additional information about the file, such as upload date, uploader’s name, and file size.
sub.location: Next to or below the FilePreview in each file entry

sub.name: FileActionMenu
sub.description: Provides options for actions that can be performed on files, such as downloading, sharing externally, or deleting.
sub.location: Adjacent to FilePreview or FileMetadata within each file entry

name: Profile & Preferences Overlay
description: An overlay window where users can access and modify account settings, preferences, themes or profile data.
location: Invoked by clicking on the user's own profile picture or name

sub.name: ProfileInfoSection
sub.description: Displays the user's profile information including avatar, display name, and email address, allowing users to edit their info.
sub.location: Top portion of the Profile & Preferences Overlay

sub.name: PreferencesMenu
sub.description: Contains various options for modifying application preferences such as notification settings, themes, and language.
sub.location: Central area within the Profile & Preferences Overlay

sub.name: AccountSettingsSection
sub.description: Provides controls for advanced account settings including security options like changing the password.
sub.location: Lower portion of the Profile & Preferences Overlay

sub.name: SaveChangesButton
sub.description: Button to save any changes made within the overlay, ensuring that user preferences are updated.
sub.location: Bottom section of the Profile & Preferences Overlay

sub.name: CloseOverlayButton
sub.description: Button that closes the overlay, discarding any unsaved changes and returning to the main interface.
sub.location: Top-right corner of the Profile & Preferences Overlay

name: Emoji Reactions
description: Allows users to react to messages using emojis, providing quick feedback without posting a follow-up message.
location: Below each message in the Main Conversation Area

sub.name: EmojiReactionItem
sub.description: Represents a single emoji reaction added to a message, displaying the emoji and the number of users who reacted.
sub.location: Clustered below or next to the message content in the Emoji Reactions area

sub.name: ReactionEmoji
sub.description: The emoji itself, representing a reaction added to a message, typically displayed alongside the count of users who reacted.
sub.location: Within each EmojiReactionItem, central element

sub.name: ReactionCountLabel
sub.description: Displays the number of users who have selected this specific emoji reaction for a message.
sub.location: Adjacent to or below the ReactionEmoji within each EmojiReactionItem

sub.name: EmojiPickerOverlay
sub.description: An overlay allowing users to select from an array of emojis to add as a reaction to a message.
sub.location: Expands from the EmojiReactionPopup when initiated

sub.name: EmojiSelectorGrid
sub.description: Grid or list of available emojis that users can choose from to add a reaction to a message.
sub.location: Within the EmojiPickerOverlay when opened

sub.name: SelectedEmojiHighlight
sub.description: Visual cue or highlight indicating an emoji that the user has chosen for reacting to a particular message.
sub.location: Overlayed or adjacent to a ReactionEmoji within the EmojiReactionPopup

sub.name: RecentEmojiList
sub.description: A section displaying the most recently used emojis for quick selection and reuse in reactions.
sub.location: Top section of the EmojiPickerOverlay for easy access

sub.name: AddReactionButton
sub.description: A button allowing users to open a menu and add new emoji reactions to a message.
sub.location: Adjacent to existing EmojiReactionItems on a message

sub.name: EmojiReactionPopup
sub.description: Popup that appears showing available emojis for users to add as reactions to a message.
sub.location: Expands from the AddReactionButton when clicked

sub.name: EmojiCategoryLabel
sub.description: Label for emoji categories (e.g., smileys, animals) to help users navigate and find specific emojis easily.
sub.location: Within the EmojiSelectorGrid, usually at the top or sidebar

sub.name: EmojiSearchInput
sub.description: Input field where users can type to search for specific emojis to react with quickly.
sub.location: Top of the EmojiPickerOverlay, providing search functionality

sub.name: EmojiFavorites
sub.description: A section displaying user's favorite or most-used emojis for quicker selection when reacting.
sub.location: Top area or a dedicated section of the EmojiPickerOverlay

sub.name: ReactionUserList
sub.description: Displays a list of users who have added a specific emoji reaction to a message.
sub.location: Inline with or accessible from each EmojiReactionItem

name: Search Bar
description: A search component that enables users to locate messages, files, or channels quickly by inputting keywords.
location: At the top of the ChatPage

sub.name: SearchInputField
sub.description: The primary input area where users can type their search queries to locate messages, files, or channels.
sub.location: Central part of the Search Bar

sub.name: SearchButton
sub.description: Button to initiate the search based on the query in the SearchInputField.
sub.location: Adjacent to the SearchInputField

sub.name: SearchFilterDropdown
sub.description: Dropdown menu that allows users to apply filters to their search, such as by type of content or date range.
sub.location: Aligned with or next to the SearchInputField

sub.name: SearchSuggestions
sub.description: Real-time suggestions that appear based on the current input in the SearchInputField, offering possible search terms or autocompletions.
sub.location: Below the SearchInputField as a dynamic dropdown

sub.name: ClearSearchButton
sub.description: Button to quickly clear the current search input, allowing users to start a new search fresh.
sub.location: Inside or next to the SearchInputField, typically to the far right

name: New Channel/Group DM Overlay
description: An overlay that allows users to create new channels or initiate new group direct message conversations by inviting other users.
location: Appears as an overlay when the respective option is chosen

name: Notifications & Mentions
description: Displays alerts when users are mentioned or when there are new messages in starred channels or direct conversations.
location: Within the Navigation Sidebar or as pop-ups on the page

sub.name: MentionAlertItem
sub.description: An alert item indicating a new mention of the user in a channel or message.
sub.location: Listed within the Notifications & Mentions area, typically in chronological order

sub.name: StarredChannelAlert
sub.description: A notification item indicating new activity or messages in channels that the user has starred.
sub.location: Within the Notifications & Mentions area, emphasized for important channels

sub.name: NotificationsSettingsLink
sub.description: A link or button that directs the user to detailed notification settings to adjust preferences.
sub.location: Bottom or as a sidebar option within the Notifications & Mentions area

sub.name: GroupMentionHighlight
sub.description: Special highlight or indicator for mentions that include group notifications or tags.
sub.location: Among MentionAlertItems, but with additional emphasis
